title: Will the NFL be liable for damages for violating antitrust laws this month?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by the end of July 2024, the NFL is confirmed to be liable for damages for violating antitrust laws. The liability must be confirmed by a federal jury or court ruling and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such a liability.

title: Will President Joe Biden drop his candidacy for re-election this month?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden announces that he is dropping his candidacy for re-election. This must be confirmed by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no such announcement is made by the end of the month, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will a House Democratic Leader call for President Joe Biden to step down as the Democratic nominee for president this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, a House Democratic Leader publicly calls for President Joe Biden to step down as the Democratic nominee for president. A 'House Democratic Leader' includes any member of the House Democratic leadership team, such as the Speaker, Majority Leader, or Whip. The call must be explicit and made in a public forum, such as an official speech, published article, or a verified social media post. The call must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such a call.

title: Will Hurricane Beryl maintain Category 5 status by the end of this week?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Hurricane Beryl maintains its Category 5 status until 11:59 PM UTC on Sunday, July 7, 2024. If Hurricane Beryl is downgraded from Category 5 status before this time, this question will resolve as NO.

title: Will more than 20 people be confirmed dead from the recent Russian missile attack in Ukraine by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, more than 20 people are confirmed dead from the recent Russian missile attack in Ukraine. The death toll must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will more than 50 people be confirmed injured from the recent Russian missile attack in Ukraine by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, more than 50 people are confirmed injured from the recent Russian missile attack in Ukraine. The injury count must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the National Rally gain more than 30 seats in the French legislative elections by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the National Rally gains more than 30 seats in the French legislative elections by the end of July 2024. The information must be confirmed by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Steve Bannon report to a federal prison to serve a sentence by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Steve Bannon reports to any federal prison to serve a sentence by the end of July 2024. Resolves as No if he does not report to any federal prison by the end of this month.

title: Will a hurricane make landfall in Jamaica this month?
body: This question will resolve as YES if a hurricane makes landfall in Jamaica by the end of July 2024. The landfall must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such an event.

title: Will Hurricane Beryl cause at least 10 fatalities by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Hurricane Beryl causes at least 10 fatalities by the end of July 2024. The fatalities must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such an event.

title: Will NASA conduct another yearlong simulated Mars mission by the end of 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if NASA initiates another yearlong simulated Mars mission by December 31, 2024. The mission must involve crew members spending at least 12 months in a simulated Mars environment. The initiation must be confirmed by an official NASA announcement or reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as NO if no such mission is initiated by the end of 2024.

title: Will President Joe Biden deport more migrants than former President Donald Trump by the end of this year?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, President Joe Biden's administration has deported more migrants than former President Donald Trump's administration did during his term. The deportation numbers must be verified by official government reports or reputable news organizations such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, or Washington Post. This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of higher deportation numbers under President Biden.

title: Will the FDA confirm a death linked to Diamond Shruumz-brand microdosing candies by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, the FDA confirms a death linked to Diamond Shruumz-brand microdosing candies. Confirmation must come from an official FDA report or announcement and be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such a death.

title: Will Prisca Thevenot's attacker be charged with assault by the end of July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Prisca Thevenot's attacker is officially charged with assault. The charge must be confirmed by a public statement from the French prosecutors or reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no such charges are filed by the end of July 2024, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a hurricane make landfall in Texas this month?
body: This question will resolve as YES if a hurricane makes landfall in Texas by July 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from at least two reputable news sources such as the National Hurricane Center, BBC, or CNN. If no hurricane makes landfall in Texas by the end of July 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Alec Baldwin be found guilty of involuntary manslaughter in the trial for the shooting death of Halyna Hutchins by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Alec Baldwin is found guilty of involuntary manslaughter in the trial for the shooting death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins by July 31, 2024. It will resolve as No if he is found not guilty or if the trial does not conclude with a verdict by the end of July 2024.

title: Will Hamas officially approve the U.S.-backed phased ceasefire deal in Gaza by the end of this month?
body: This question resolves as YES if Hamas officially approves the U.S.-backed phased ceasefire deal in Gaza by July 31, 2024. Official approval must be announced by a recognized Hamas spokesperson or official and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no official approval is announced by the end of the month, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will Apple succeed in getting a Chinese court to alter its written ruling by the end of this month?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple succeeds in getting a Chinese court to alter its written ruling in a lawsuit the iPhone maker won. The alteration must be officially confirmed and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as NO if no such alteration is confirmed by the resolution date.

title: Will former President Donald Trump face trial in Washington for the 2020 election interference case by the end of this year?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, former President Donald Trump faces trial in Washington for the 2020 election interference case. The trial must commence in a court in Washington, D.C., and be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If the trial does not commence by the end of the year, this question resolves as No.

title: Will white nationalist leaders and organizations be ordered to pay additional damages for the Charlottesville Unite the Right violence by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, white nationalist leaders and organizations are ordered to pay additional damages beyond the $26 million already ordered for the Charlottesville Unite the Right violence. This must be confirmed by a jury or court ruling reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no additional damages are ordered by the end of July 2024, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will more than five people be hospitalized due to the fireworks incident at the Fourth of July celebration in Provo, Utah this month?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, more than five people are confirmed to have been hospitalized due to the fireworks incident at the Fourth of July celebration in Provo, Utah. The hospitalization must be directly related to injuries from the malfunctioning fireworks as reported by reputable news organizations. This question resolves as NO if five or fewer people are confirmed to have been hospitalized due to the incident.

title: Will President Joe Biden announce his withdrawal from the presidential race by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden announces his withdrawal from the presidential race. The announcement must be made in a public forum, such as an official speech, press release, or a verified social media post, and must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such an announcement.

title: Will Donald Trump stand trial before the November 2024 election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, Donald Trump stands trial in any court of law. This question resolves as No if he does not stand trial by this date.

title: Will a Republican leader publicly call for replacing President Joe Biden with Vice President Kamala Harris on the Democratic ticket by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, a current Republican leader publicly calls for replacing President Joe Biden with Vice President Kamala Harris on the Democratic ticket. A 'Republican leader' is defined as a current or former head of the Republican National Committee, a current Republican member of Congress, or a current Republican governor. The call must be explicit and made in a public forum, such as an official speech, published article, or a verified social media post. The call must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such a call.

title: Will the Supreme Court rule against FDA decisions blocking the marketing of sweet flavored e-cigarettes by the end of this year?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Supreme Court rules against the FDA's decisions blocking the marketing of sweet flavored e-cigarettes. The ruling must be officially announced and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as NO if the Supreme Court does not rule against the FDA's decisions by the end of this year.

title: Will President Joe Biden win the Democratic Party's nomination for the 2024 Presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by the end of July 2024, President Joe Biden is confirmed as the Democratic Party's nominee for the 2024 Presidential election. Confirmation must come from an official announcement by the Democratic Party and be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Miki Sudo defend her title at the Nathan's hot dog eating contest in 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Miki Sudo wins the women's title at the Nathan's hot dog eating contest in 2024. The contest is held annually on the Fourth of July. A win is defined as consuming the most hot dogs within the contest's rules and being declared the winner by the event organizers. This question resolves as NO if Miki Sudo does not win the women's title.

title: Will Andrew Tate be allowed to leave the EU by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, Andrew Tate is allowed to leave the European Union. This will be confirmed by official court rulings or verified news reports. If no such confirmation is available by the end of July 2024, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Supreme Court make a final decision on the Texas and Florida social media regulation cases by the end of this year?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Supreme Court makes a final decision on the cases regarding Texas and Florida's efforts to regulate how social media platforms like Facebook, TikTok, X, and YouTube manage content posted by their users. The decision must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of ambiguous statements, the resolution will be based on the consensus interpretation by these reporting news organizations.

title: Will Meta Platforms be found in violation of the EU's digital competition rules by the end of this month?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Meta Platforms is officially found in violation of the European Union's digital competition rules due to their policy of forcing Facebook and Instagram users to choose between seeing ads or paying to avoid them. The resolution will be based on an official announcement or ruling by the relevant EU regulatory body. If no such announcement or ruling is made by the end of July 2024, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a judge block Mayor Cherelle Parker's requirement that Philadelphia city employees return to their offices full time by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, a judge issues a ruling to block Mayor Cherelle Parker's requirement that Philadelphia city employees return to their offices full time. The ruling must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no such ruling is issued by the end of July 2024, this question resolves as No.

title: Will Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment exit Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment, the parent company of DVD rental operator Redbox, successfully exits Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection by December 31, 2024. Exiting bankruptcy protection means the company has completed the reorganization process and has been approved by the bankruptcy court to resume normal operations. This must be verified by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If the company does not exit Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection by this date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Google's emissions decrease in 2024 compared to 2023?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Google's emissions in 2024 are lower than in 2023, as reported in Google's annual Environmental Report for 2024. If the emissions are the same or higher, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the merger between Paramount and Skydance be completed by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, the merger between Paramount and Skydance is officially completed. Completion is defined as the finalization of all necessary legal and financial steps required to merge the two companies, as reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If the merger is not completed by this date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will the acquisition of Neiman Marcus Group by the parent company of Saks Fifth Avenue be completed by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the acquisition of Neiman Marcus Group by the parent company of Saks Fifth Avenue is completed by July 31, 2024. Completion is defined as the finalization of all legal, regulatory, and financial processes required for the acquisition. This must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If the acquisition is not completed by this date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the U.S. Committee on Foreign Investment expand its jurisdiction to review land sales near 56 additional military sites by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) expands its jurisdiction to review land sales near 56 additional military sites. The expansion must be officially announced and documented by the U.S. Treasury. This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such an expansion.

title: Will President Joe Biden cancel his planned speech at the National Education Association conference this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden cancels his planned speech at the annual conference of the National Education Association in Philadelphia. The cancellation must be officially announced and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If the speech is not canceled or no official announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the first phase of the Mandan, Hidatsa and Arikara Nation's greenhouse project be completed by February 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the first phase of the Mandan, Hidatsa and Arikara Nation's greenhouse project is completed by February 28, 2025. The resolution will be based on official announcements from the Mandan, Hidatsa and Arikara Nation or credible news reports confirming the completion of the first phase. If there are no such confirmations by the end of February 2025, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Boeing plead guilty to fraud in connection with the 737 Max crashes by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Boeing pleads guilty to fraud in connection with the 737 Max crashes by July 31, 2024. If Boeing does not plead guilty by this date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Boeing avoid going to trial for the 737 Max crashes by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Boeing avoids going to trial for the 737 Max crashes by July 31, 2024, due to a plea deal being accepted by a judge. If Boeing goes to trial or the plea deal is not accepted by this date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the death toll from the propane tank explosion in Izmir, Turkey, increase by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the death toll from the propane tank explosion at a restaurant in Izmir, Turkey, increases from the current count of five by July 31, 2024. If the death toll remains at five or decreases, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the number of injured from the propane tank explosion in Izmir, Turkey, increase by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the number of injured from the propane tank explosion at a restaurant in Izmir, Turkey, increases from the current count of 63 by July 31, 2024. If the number of injured remains at 63 or decreases, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will Boeing's acquisition of Spirit AeroSystems for $4.7 billion in stock be completed by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Boeing's acquisition of Spirit AeroSystems for $4.7 billion in an all-stock transaction is completed by December 31, 2024. The completion of the acquisition must be confirmed by a reputable news organization and announced by Boeing. If the acquisition is not completed by the end of 2024, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will emergency room doctors be required to perform emergency abortions to save a pregnant woman's health this month?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by the end of July 2024, emergency room doctors are mandated to perform emergency abortions when necessary to save a pregnant woman's health, as directed by the Biden administration following the recent Supreme Court ruling. The mandate must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the CEO of Tractor Supply resign by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the CEO of Tractor Supply resigns by July 31, 2024. The resignation must be officially announced by the company or confirmed by reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as NO if the CEO does not resign by the specified date.

title: Will the U.S. Education Department's plan to lower monthly payments for student loan borrowers be implemented by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Education Department's plan to lower monthly payments for student loan borrowers is implemented. The implementation must be officially confirmed by the U.S. Education Department or reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). title: Will a Chinese firm announce a new electric vehicle manufacturing investment in Morocco by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, a Chinese firm publicly announces a new investment in electric vehicle manufacturing in Morocco. The announcement must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such an announcement.

title: Will the Kenyan government declare a state of emergency due to flooding by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the Kenyan government declares a state of emergency due to flooding by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be officially made by the Kenyan government and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no such declaration is made by the specified date, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will the Kenyan government provide financial aid to farmers affected by the recent flooding by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the Kenyan government announces and provides financial aid specifically to farmers affected by the recent flooding by July 31, 2024. The aid must be officially announced and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no such aid is provided by the specified date, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will there be no reported injuries from the North Dakota train derailment by the end of this week?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the end of this week (July 7, 2024), there are no reported injuries related to the North Dakota train derailment incident. The incident involved railcars carrying hazardous material which derailed in a remote area of North Dakota. Officials have stated that no one has been hurt as of now. The resolution will be based on reports from reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, CNN, New York Times).

title: Will the fire from the derailed rail cars in North Dakota be fully extinguished by the end of this week?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the fire from the derailed rail cars carrying hazardous material in North Dakota is fully extinguished by the end of this week (July 7, 2024). The confirmation must come from reputable news sources or official statements from emergency officials. If the fire is not fully extinguished by the end of this week, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will sales of previously occupied U.S. homes fall in June 2024 compared to June 2023?
body: This question will resolve as YES if sales of previously occupied U.S. homes in June 2024 are reported to be lower than those in June 2023. The comparison will be based on official data released by the National Association of Realtors or another reputable source. This question resolves as NO if sales in June 2024 are higher or the same as those in June 2023.

title: Will South Korea withdraw its plan to suspend licenses of striking doctors by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, South Korea withdraws its plan to suspend licenses of striking doctors as part of its efforts to resolve the country's months-long medical impasse. This decision must be officially announced by the South Korean government and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will most medical students at Johns Hopkins University no longer pay tuition starting this fall?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, starting in the fall of 2024, most medical students at Johns Hopkins University no longer pay tuition due to the $1 billion gift from Bloomberg Philanthropies. 'Most' is defined as more than 50% of the medical students. This will be confirmed by an official announcement from Johns Hopkins University or a reputable news source such as Bloomberg, The New York Times, or The Washington Post. This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such an announcement.

title: Will the Biden administration delay consideration of gas export projects by the end of July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the Biden administration delays consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas by July 31, 2024. This question resolves as NO if there is no delay in consideration by the specified date.

title: Will the Supreme Court rule in favor of the North Dakota truck stop in their regulation challenge by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Supreme Court rules in favor of the North Dakota truck stop in their challenge against a federal regulation. The ruling must be explicitly in favor of the truck stop and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such a ruling.

title: Will U.S. wildlife officials deploy trained shooters to kill barred owls in West Coast forests by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if by July 31, 2024, U.S. wildlife officials have deployed trained shooters into dense West Coast forests to kill barred owls. The deployment must be officially confirmed and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such deployment.

title: Will the US add more than 200,000 jobs in June 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the official jobs report for June 2024 confirms that more than 200,000 jobs were added in the US. The resolution will be based on the report released by the Bureau of Labor Statistics. This question resolves as YES if the number of jobs added exceeds 200,000.

title: Will Juneau, Alaska vote to ban cruise ships on Saturdays by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the voters in Juneau, Alaska vote in favor of the initiative to ban cruise ships on Saturdays. The vote must be officially confirmed and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., AP, Reuters, BBC). If the vote does not take place or the initiative is not passed, this question will resolve as NO.

title: Will a federal judge accept Boeing's plea deal by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as YES if a federal judge accepts Boeing's plea deal related to the criminal fraud charge stemming from two deadly crashes of 737 Max jetliners by July 31, 2024. If the plea deal is not accepted by this date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will French Prime Minister Attal remain in office by the end of July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, French Prime Minister Attal remains in office. It resolves as No if he leaves office before this date for any reason.

title: Will the Labour Party form a majority government in the UK by the end of this month?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 31, 2024, the Labour Party has officially formed a majority government in the UK. A majority government is defined as having more than half the seats in the House of Commons. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such an event.

title: Will Meta be banned from using data originating in Brazil to train its AI models this month?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the ban on Meta using data originating in Brazil to train its AI models remains in effect as determined by Brazil's national data protection authority. If Meta is allowed to use data from Brazil to train its AI models by the end of July 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the Biden administration's proposed rule to address excessive heat in the workplace be finalized by the end of this year?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the proposed rule by the Biden administration to address excessive heat in the workplace is finalized by December 31, 2024. If the rule is not finalized by this date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Arizona's abortion rights issue be placed on the November general election ballot this year?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the end of November 2024, the abortion rights issue is confirmed to be placed on Arizona's general election ballot. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of ambiguous reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus interpretation by these reporting news organizations. This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of the issue being placed on the ballot.
